intro: Seseli longifolium subsp. longifolium, commonly known as long-leaved seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound leaves that are often finely divided. The flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in mountainous regions. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
